summary: This document appears to be a forwarded email exchange from February 2007, likely from Sarah Ransome to an Epstein associate (Kellen). The sender discusses difficulties with a late application, requests Jeffrey Epstein's guidance, provides a weight update (57kg), and asks for a flight to be booked from Cape Town back to New York.

persons.name: Sarah Ransome
persons.context: Sender of the email discussing application issues, weight, and travel arrangements; communicates through a Proton Mail address and mentions being in Cape Town.

persons.name: Kellen
persons.context: Recipient of the email; appears to be an employee of Jeffrey Epstein based on the document's label 'Epstein Employee' and is asked to relay messages to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Jeffery'; the sender requests Kellen to ask him about an application plan, provide a phone number, and check about booking a flight.

connections.description: Sarah is communicating with Kellen, an Epstein employee, to relay messages and requests to Jeffrey Epstein.
Sarah seeks Epstein's guidance on an application and travel arrangements, indicating a direct or indirect association.
Kellen is identified as an 'Epstein Employee' and is asked to convey messages to Epstein.

events.title: Email from Sarah Ransome
events.description: Sarah Ransome emails Kellen about application issues, weight update (57kg), and requests to contact Jeffrey Epstein for guidance and flight booking.

events.title: Requested flight to New York
events.description: Sarah Ransome requests a flight to be booked from Cape Town back to New York for February 27, 2007.

keyFacts: Sarah Ransome, using a Proton Mail address, communicates with Epstein employee Kellen in February 2007.
The email discusses an application issue requiring Jeffrey Epstein's input, a weight update (57kg), and a request to book a flight from Cape Town to New York.
The correspondence suggests Epstein's involvement in personal and logistical details of associates, including travel arrangements.
